answers.answer: Im choosing to breastfeed also. But im a first time mom...when ever me n the docs talk about it it sounds like im basically going back to how i was pre pregnancy with my meds n my baby will b fine!

I breastfed my first two and will with this one. I didn't notice any significant changes with my insulin dose or anything. Obviously once the baby is born, you return to prepregnancy carb ratios, but it only takes a day or so of adjustment. Breastfeeding just fits right in, it doesn't change your insulin needs. That was my experience anyway.

Great question!  I don't have any info to add to this as I am not diabetic.  I know from experience however, that when I had questions I'd ask!  :-)I spoke to the nurses at the hospital and my doctor and my friends and the lactation consultant at the hospital and anyone else who would listen!  Hopefully more mommas will post with their experiences!  Best of luck!
